revised_title: Deep Sea Floor Development and International Law: Challenges and Progress in the Law of the Sea
tldr: This article discusses the development of international law and ocean governance in relation to the deep sea floor. It highlights the challenges faced by the third United Nations Conference on the Law of the Sea in reaching a global agreement on the limits of coastal states' rights and the exploration and exploitation of the deep seabed. The article also explores the evolution of maritime law and the impact of state practices on traditional concepts of freedom of the seas. It covers topics such as the territorial sea, the continental shelf, the high seas, and fishing and conservation of living resources. The article concludes by discussing the procedural challenges faced by the Conference and the progress made in establishing a comprehensive treaty for ocean governance.
